intro: Neanotis indica, commonly known as the Indian spurge, is a flowering plant native to South and Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Neanotis indica is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
